## Project-specific Discount Rate

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
rf <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.03, sd = 0.005)
mrp <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.06, sd = 0.005)
beta_proj <- rnorm(1, mean = 1.4, sd = 0.1)
```

Aurora Technologies considers investing in a high-risk digital platform.  
- Risk-free rate = **`r round(rf*100,2)`**%  
- Market risk premium = **`r round(mrp*100,2)`**%  
- Project beta = **`r round(beta_proj,2)`**  

::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault();" style="display: flex; flex-direction: row; gap: 6px;">
  <label for="module4_num_q10a"><strong>1. What is the appropriate discount rate for this project (in %)?</strong></label>
  <input type="number" id="module4_num_q10a" name="module4_num_q10a" style="width: 150px;"
         data-correct-answer=`r round((rf + beta_proj*mrp)*100,2)` data-tolerance="0.01" />
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_num_q10a" class="feedback" style="display:none;">
✅ Discount Rate = r<sub>f</sub> + β<sub>project</sub> × MRP = **`r round((rf + beta_proj*mrp)*100,2)`**%.  
Projects with higher betas require higher discount rates to compensate investors for risk.
</div>
:::
